intro: Argostemma membranaceum, commonly known as the membranous argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
